hw.name: Homework 1

question.p: The figure below is a histogram showing the distribution of blood pressure for all 14,148 women in a drug study. Use the histogram to answer the following questions:

ol.li:
The percentage of women with blood pressures above 130mm is around:
25% 50% 75%

The percentage of women with blood pressures between 90mm and 160mm is around:
1% 50% 99%

In which interval are there more women?
135-140mm 140-150mm

On the interval 125-130mm, the height of the histogram is about 2.1% per mm. What percentage of women had blood pressures in this class interval?
[8, 12]

question.p: Below are sketches of histograms for three lists.

ol.li:
What are the averages of the three histograms?
(i) 40, (ii) 50, (iii) 60 (i) 40, (ii) 60, (iii) 50 (i) 50, (ii) 40, (iii) 60 (i) 50, (ii) 60, (iii) 40 (i) 60, (ii) 40, (iii) 50 (i) 60, (ii) 50, (iii) 40

Match the histogram with the description.
(i) median < average
(ii) median = average
(iii) median > average
(i) median < average
(ii) median > average
(iii) median = average
(i) median = average
(ii) median < average
(iii) median > average
(i) median = average
(ii) median > average
(iii) median < average
(i) median > average
(ii) median < average
(iii) median = average
(i) median > average
(ii) median = average
(iii) median < average

The SD of histogram (iii) is around:
5 15 50

True or false: the SD for histogram (i) is a lot smaller than that for histogram (iii).
True False

question.p: As part of a study on the effects of flu, some doctors took the temperatures of 200 flu patients in their third day of illness. They obtained the following histogram:

ol.li:
What is the median (50th percentile) temperature of the 200 flu patients?
[99.4, 99.6]

From another part of the hospital, another 50 patients are found to have temperatures between 96 and 98. These patients are combined with the rest and a new histogram is drawn for all 250 patients. The height of the rectangle with base 96-98 degrees becomes
[12, 12]

question.p: A study on college students found that the men had an average weight of about 66 kg and an SD of about 9 kg. The women had an average weight of about 55 kg and an SD of 9 kg.

ol.li:
Find the averages and SDs, in pounds. (1 kg = 2.2 lb)
AverageSD
Men
[145,145.3] lb
[19,20] lb
Women
[121,121] lb
[19,20] lb

Just roughly, what percentage of the men weighed between 57 and 75 kg?
[68, 68.4] %

li.p: If you took the men and women together, would the SD of their weights be smaller than 9 kg, just about 9 kg, or bigger than 9 kg?

ol.li:
For a sample of 1,000 women age 25-34 with full time jobs, the average income in 2004 was \$32,000. The SD was \$26,000, and 1/4 of 1% had incomes above \$150,000. About what percentage with incomes in the range from \$32,000 to \$150,000?
40% 50% 60%

The incomes of the 1,000 women ranged from \$15,000 to \$200,000. However, by accident, the highest income is recorded as \$2,000,000.
How much higher is the recorded average than the true average?
[1800,1800]
How much higher is the recorded median than the true median?
[0,0]

hw.question:
For a certain group of women, the 25th percentile of height is 62.2 inches and the 75th percentile is 65.8 inches. The histogram follows the normal curve. Find the 90th percentile of the height distribution.
[67.3, 67.7]
Among applicants to one law school, the average LSAT score was about 169, the SD was about 9, and the highest score was 178. True or false: the LSAT scores follow the normal curve.

question.p: In 2006, Harvard University President Larry Summers resigned over remarks he made about women in math and science. However, contrary to popular belief, what he suggested was not that women are any less intelligent than men (on average), but that women's intelligences are less variable than men's. He noted that among the top 5% of twelfth graders, there was one woman for every two men.
In this problem, we will show that based on this data, the SD of men's IQs is larger than the SD of women's IQs. This is a challenging problem, so let's walk through the steps together.

ul.li:
IQ scores follow the normal curve with mean 100 and SD 15. What IQ score marks the cutoff for the top 5% (i.e., the 95th percentile)?
[124, 125]

The percentage of all people with an IQ above the score you calculated in (a) is, of course, 5%, but what percentage of men have an IQ above that score? (Remember that men make up about 50% of the population, and that the data show that there are about twice as many men as women in that range.)
[3.2, 3.4] %

You now know the percentage of men with an IQ above the score in (a). Remember that Summers was assuming that men and women have the same average IQ score (100). This should enable you to determine the SD of men's IQs.
[16, 17]

Repeat (b) and (c), but for women's IQs. What is the SD of women's IQs?
[13, 14]

question.p: A scientist wants to measure the boiling point of mercury at sea level. She makes the following five temperature measurements, in degrees Celsius: 353.81, 360.13, 356.22, 359.79, 351.41.
What is the standard deviation of her temperature measurements?

Her boss, however, insists that she take her measurements in degrees Kelvin. To convert from Celsius to Kelvin, you simply add 273.15 degrees. Thus, the scientist's temperature measurements, expressed in degrees Kelvin, are: 626.96, 633.28, 629.37, 632.94, 624.56.
Now what is the standard deviation of her temperatures measurements, (expressed in Kelvin)?
